TOP STORIES

Governor sees ‘opportunity’ for Wyoming in Trump tariff war. Economist sees ‘disaster.’

by Dustin Bleizeffer 4 hours agoMay 5, 2025

Study: Most Yellowstone, Grand Teton visitors support added fee for wildlife conservation

by Katie Klingsporn 4 hours agoMay 5, 2025

As Wyoming GOP gathers, old disputes resurface

by Maggie Mullen 14 hours agoMay 5, 2025

Despite reports, BLM’s Rock Springs plan lives on. But congressional budgeting could kill it.

by Mike Koshmrl 15 hours agoMay 5, 2025

Wrongful death suit challenges Thermopolis cop for illegally entering home

May 5, 2025May 2, 2025

Togwotee Pass grizzlies attract vexing highway hazard

May 3, 2025May 2, 2025

Yellowstone grizzly managers — dispersed and reduced by DOGE — shine little light on delisting battle

May 2, 2025May 2, 2025

Corner-crossing experts urge caution for Wyoming recreators in wake of ruling

May 2, 2025May 2, 2025

Newcastle oil refinery restarts operations after it ‘went boom’ in February

May 2, 2025May 1, 2025

Wyoming GOP to select new leadership

May 2, 2025May 1, 2025

Wyoming’s independent news for independent thinkers

OPINION

Federal court ruling protects Wyoming student’s pronoun, name preferences

by Kerry Drake 4 hours agoMay 5, 2025

Time to strengthen the Wyoming Public Records Act

by Marta Mossburg May 5, 2025May 2, 2025

Attacks on DEI highlight the fallacy of zero-sum thinking

by Ken Chestek May 2, 2025May 1, 2025

INVESTIGATIONS

The ‘ticking time bomb’ facing Wyoming’s public defenders and their clients

January 7, 2025March 19, 2025

Ex-eye bank workers say pressure, lax oversight led to errors

November 20, 2024November 19, 2024

A student died on campus, and the University of Wyoming stayed silent for 3 weeks

October 24, 2024October 25, 2024

PEOPLE & PLACES

Run for the racks

May 2, 2025May 1, 2025

Despite DOGE at Interior, Yellowstone staffing ‘higher than last year’

April 22, 2025April 21, 2025

As international visitors stay away, Yellowstone tourism industry banks on Americans

April 18, 2025April 17, 2025

PHOTOGRAPHY

Waxy, furry, tiny signs of spring

Forest-dwelling raptor, aka ‘flying mountain lion,’ goes for groceries in the city

Dogs against DOGE: Wyoming canines join protest crowds

IN CASE YOU MISSED IT

Governor: Trade mission to Japan, Taiwan could increase Wyoming fossil fuel exports

Though the islands are interested in Wyoming coal, deals might not come in time to help beleaguered Kemmerer coal mine, Gordon said.
by Dustin Bleizeffer May 1, 2025April 30, 2025

Wyoming legislators to review public records, open meetings laws

Complaints about fees and timeliness led a legislative committee to prioritize the issue this off-season.
by Maggie Mullen May 1, 2025April 30, 2025

BLM Wyoming director on leave after probe finds ethics violations

Federal investigation determined that Andrew Archuleta accepted gifts and used government resources in ways that conflict with ethics policies.
by Katie Klingsporn April 30, 2025May 1, 2025

How will Trump’s effort to revitalize coal play out in the nation’s most productive coal fields?

Western tribal groups and environmentalists defend the recent ban on new Powder River Basin coal mining leases, but Trump and Wyoming covet a coal comeback.
by Jake Bolster, Inside Climate News April 30, 2025April 29, 2025

Judge: Rock Springs school didn’t violate parental rights in transgender pronoun case

School district officials, educators did not keep information from high schooler’s parents or violate mother’s religious rights, federal judge concludes.
by Joshua Wolfson April 29, 2025May 2, 2025

In honoring fallen workers, advocates call for action in Wyoming

The state’s perpetual ranking as among the deadliest in the nation for workers points to systemic disregard, advocates say.
by Dustin Bleizeffer April 29, 2025April 29, 2025
